title: Jasprit Bumrah Breaks Silence On "Bed Rest" Report Amid Champions Trophy Concerns - NDTV Sports
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah Breaks Silence On "Bed Rest" Report Amid Champions Trophy Concerns

Publication Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: NDTV

Team India pacer Jasprit Bumrah has denied reports suggesting he was advised to take bed rest before the Champions Trophy, asserting the claims are false.

  • Bumrah labels the bed rest reports as fake news.
  • He recently suffered an injury scare during a Test match against Australia.
  • Bumrah ended the series as the highest wicket-taker with 32 wickets.
  • He was named Player of the Series for his outstanding performance.
  • Bumrah has received nominations for ICC Awards 2024.
"I know fake news is easy to spread but this made me laugh. Sources unreliable." — Jasprit Bumrah

Bumrah aims to continue his success as he prepares for the upcoming Champions Trophy. His strong performances have marked a memorable year for the bowler.
newTitle: Jasprit Bumrah Dismisses Bed Rest Claims Ahead of Champions Trophy

title: Rules From Virat Kohli's Captaincy Back? BCCI Planning Big U-Turn Amid Slump In Form: Report - NDTV Sports
summary:
Rules From Virat Kohli's Captaincy Back? BCCI Planning Big U-Turn Amid Slump In Form: Report

Publication Date: 15 January 2025 Source: NDTV

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is reportedly considering reinstating old fitness rules from Virat Kohli's captaincy amidst the team's recent struggles under head coach Gautam Gambhir. This includes potentially reintroducing the mandatory yo-yo fitness test, which was previously removed to ease the players' workload.

  • BCCI is dissatisfied with Team India's performance since the arrival of Gautam Gambhir as head coach.
  • There are discussions within the BCCI to reintroduce old fitness criteria for player selection.
  • The mandatory yo-yo fitness test was previously lifted to prevent injuries but could make a comeback.
  • Concerns have been raised about players' complacency due to the absence of strict fitness standards.
  • Changes may also include limiting the stay of players' families during overseas tours to avoid distractions.
  • A new rule will mandate all players to travel with the team to strengthen cohesion.
“The board had gone lenient on the players since they are mostly on the road... A certain fitness level criteria needs to be reintroduced so that complacency doesn't creep in,” said a source.

This potential shift in BCCI's approach highlights their commitment to enhancing team performance and discipline as they aim to improve results on the international stage.
newTitle: BCCI Considering Return to Kohli-Era Fitness Rules Amid Team Struggles

title: Mumbai selectors to approach Rohit Sharma over Ranji Trophy availability amid continued uncertainty - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mumbai Selectors to Approach Rohit Sharma for Ranji Trophy Participation

Date: Jan 16, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Team India captain Rohit Sharma has not confirmed his availability for the upcoming Ranji Trophy match against Jammu and Kashmir. Amidst his recent poor performance, the Mumbai Cricket Association plans to engage with him for his selection.

  • Rohit Sharma's performance has drawn scrutiny due to low scores in previous Test series.
  • The MCA confirms it will approach Sharma for selection before announcing the squad.
  • A scheduled squad announcement is expected on January 20.
  • Young talents Yashasvi Jaiswal, Shubman Gill, and Rishabh Pant are confirmed to play in upcoming Ranji matches.
“If you don’t give importance to domestic cricket, you will never get the desired players that you want,” said head coach Gautam Gambhir.

The selectors' decision will be crucial for both Rohit Sharma and the Mumbai team as the Ranji Trophy season continues.
newTitle: Mumbai Selectors to Approach Rohit Sharma for Ranji Trophy Participation

title: Jasprit Bumrah follows Mohammed Shami to clear the air on reports of being advised bed rest to recover from a back injury - Crictoday
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah Addresses Bed Rest Rumors Amid Injury Recovery

Publication Date: Not specified

Source: Cric Today

Jasprit Bumrah recently spoke out regarding rumors about needing bed rest to recover from a back injury. He has mocked claims circulating on social media and has addressed the uncertainty surrounding his fitness for the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

  • Bumrah was injured in the final Test against Australia due to back spasms.
  • Medical staff recommend rest to recover from back swelling before rehabilitation can continue.
  • He criticized a social media user for spreading false information regarding his injury status.
  • Bumrah was instrumental in his recent series against Australia, taking 32 wickets.
“I know fake news is easy to spread but this made me laugh. Sources unreliable,” wrote Bumrah on his social media account.

The article highlights the broader implications of misinformation in sports and the pressure athletes face in maintaining their public image.
newTitle: Jasprit Bumrah Addresses Bed Rest Rumors Amid Injury Recovery

title: Why did PUMA rebrand itself as PVMA ? - The Times of India
summary:
PUMA Rebrands as PVMA in Honor of PV Sindhu

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

PUMA India has undertaken a significant rebranding initiative, temporarily changing its signage to “PVMA” in celebration of its new collaboration with badminton champion PV Sindhu.

  • The rebranding symbolizes PUMA's official entry into badminton.
  • The campaign generated excitement online and involved changing signage in select stores across India.
  • A new badminton range will launch featuring high-performance products.
  • PV Sindhu joins an elite roster of PUMA athletes, including various sports stars and influencers.
  • 57 million fans of badminton are currently in India, with a growing interest among Gen Z.
  • Official debut of the collaboration is set for the India Open 2025.
“I hope to inspire others, especially women, to take risks, believe in themselves, and strive for greatness both on and off the court.” - PV Sindhu

This partnership not only enhances badminton’s profile in India but also aims to inspire a new generation of players through innovative sport initiatives.
newTitle: PUMA Rebrands as PVMA in Honor of PV Sindhu

title: Report: Man Utd striker wants to join Barcelona - English Premier League Index - Opta Stats
summary:
Report: Rashford Prioritises Barcelona Amid January Transfer Speculation

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Sport

Marcus Rashford has become a key target for Barcelona as they look to enhance their attacking options during the January transfer window. Rashford has expressed a desire to join Barcelona but has set a deadline of January 15 for the club's response regarding a potential loan.

  • Barcelona considering Rashford primarily as a loan option.
  • Hansi Flick supports the move, citing Rashford's versatility.
  • Concerns exist within Barcelona about Rashford's consistency and off-field issues.
  • Rashford's representatives are exploring other offers from AC Milan and Borussia Dortmund.
  • A meeting with Dortmund officials indicates interest but Rashford prefers a move to Barcelona.
“Rashford brings a dynamic edge to the game, and his skill set aligns with the demands of modern football.”

In conclusion, while Rashford’s potential transfer to Barcelona is steeped in hope for personal revival, it raises questions about Manchester United’s management of his talents and future implications for the club.
newTitle: Rashford Prioritizes Move to Barcelona Amid Transfer Speculation

title: Ruben Amorim names pacey Man Utd wonderkid who is 'training really well' - Metro.co.uk
Durbar Rajshahi's local players skip training to protest non-payment of fees - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Local Players of Durbar Rajshahi Protest Non-Payment by Skipping Training

Publication Date: January 10, 2024 | Source: ESPNcricinfo

Durbar Rajshahi's Bangladeshi players opted to skip a training session in Chattogram to protest their unpaid fees by the BPL franchise, which has led to significant unrest among the local players.

  • The training session was canceled after players voiced their concerns over delayed payments.
  • Overseas players received 25% of their fees only after the fourth match of the season.
  • The board president discussed the issue with Rajshahi's management in an attempt to resolve the matter.
  • Players faced bounced cheques, leading to threats of not participating in an upcoming match.
  • The franchise has not followed the BPL payment schedule as required.
“We haven’t been paid our wages. None of us have.” — Anamul Haque, Captain of Durbar Rajshahi

The situation remains tense, with players threatening to withdraw from future games unless payments are made promptly.
newTitle: Local Players of Durbar Rajshahi Protest Non-Payment by Skipping Training

title: Titled Tuesday Sets Participation Record, Hikaru Joins 2025 Win Column - Chess.com
summary:
Titled Tuesday Sets Participation Record, Hikaru Joins 2025 Win Column

Date: January 14, 2025 | Source: Chess.com

The latest Titled Tuesday event attracted a record 905 participants, marking the highest turnout since June 2020. GM Arjun Erigaisi won the early tournament, while GM Hikaru Nakamura secured his first victory of 2025 in the late tournament.

  • The event saw GM Arjun Erigaisi score 10 points but needed tiebreaks to win against GM Hikaru Nakamura.
  • Nakamura finished with 9.5 points and won the late event, his first of the year.
  • Over 25,000 viewers watched the event live on Twitch/X.
“Over 25k watched on Twitch / X. @chesscom truly has the strongest tournament in the world TWICE every Tuesday!!” — Hikaru Nakamura

The Titled Tuesday series continues to draw significant participation and viewer engagement, highlighting its popularity within the chess community.
newTitle: Titled Tuesday Sets Participation Record, Hikaru Joins 2025 Win Column

summary:

Date: January 15, 2025 Source: Crystal Palace F.C.

Chelsea has officially activated the option to recall Trevoh Chalobah from his loan at Crystal Palace, which follows previous confusion regarding the terms of his loan.

We can confirm that Chelsea have activated an option to recall Trevoh Chalobah from his loan spell. We’d like to thank Trevoh for his hard work in red and blue and wish him all the best for the future. — Crystal Palace F.C.

Chalobah is expected to challenge for a first-team place at Chelsea for the rest of the season, though a permanent departure is anticipated by season's end.

This recall comes as Chelsea faces defensive issues due to injuries to key players.

Cristiano Ronaldo 'accepts offer' with ex-Man Utd star to 'receive £168m' after 'requesting reunion' - Football365
summary:
Cristiano Ronaldo Accepts £168m Contract Renewal with Al-Nassr

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Football365

Cristiano Ronaldo has accepted an offer to renew his contract with Al-Nassr, set to earn £168m over the duration. This comes after suggestions of a reunion with Manchester United.

  • Ronaldo scored 18 goals in 30 Premier League appearances for Manchester United in the 2021/22 season.
  • He left Manchester United in 2022 following disagreements with coach Erik ten Hag.
  • The player has expressed interest in continuing with Al-Nassr beyond this season.
  • Ronaldo has made 84 appearances, scoring 75 goals for Al-Nassr since his arrival.
  • Reports suggest he requested a reunion with former United teammate Casemiro.
“I not only believe, but I’m almost certain that he’ll be [at the 2026 World Cup],” said Bruno Fernandes about Ronaldo’s future.

This renewal points towards Ronaldo’s commitment to Al-Nassr while considering his next steps in professional football.
newTitle: Cristiano Ronaldo Accepts £168m Contract Renewal with Al-Nassr

title: South Africa pacer ruled out of ICC Men’s Champions Trophy 2025 - ICC Cricket
summary:
South Africa Pacer Excluded from ICC Men’s Champions Trophy 2025

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: ICC Cricket

South African pacer Anrich Nortje has been ruled out of the upcoming ICC Men’s Champions Trophy 2025 due to a back injury.

  • Nortje missed the 2023 Cricket World Cup in India because of a stress fracture in his back.
  • The 31-year-old fast bowler had an impressive record with 36 wickets in 22 ODIs and 53 wickets in 42 T20Is.
  • His last ODI appearance was over 15 months ago against Australia.
  • South Africa retains a strong squad, with 10 of the 15 players from the 2023 World Cup semi-final team selected for the Champions Trophy.
“Nortje’s steady variation, bounce, and pace have been pivotal in South Africa's pace unit in the white-ball format.”

This ruling out is a significant blow to South Africa's pace attack as they prepare for the Champions Trophy, where they aim to build on their recent successes.
newTitle: South Africa Pacer Excluded from ICC Men’s Champions Trophy 2025

title: Jasprit Bumrah told to take bed rest, no chance of returning to action - Crictoday
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah Advised to Take Bed Rest Amid Injury Concerns

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Crictoday

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has not commented on Jasprit Bumrah's back injury or his potential return. The fast bowler is expected to miss the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025 due to his condition.

  • Bumrah has been instructed to rest while there is uncertainty regarding his injury.
  • He experienced back spasms during a Test match against Australia and underwent scans.
  • Reports indicate that he will visit the BCCI’s Centre of Excellence for further evaluation.
  • There is no set date for his return, and he might be sidelined for a significant period.
  • The selectors are awaiting a report on his condition before deciding on the team for the Champions Trophy.
“Bed rest is not a good thing for the pacer. I hope he is not down with disc bulge or a muscle swelling.”

In conclusion, Jasprit Bumrah’s injury raises concerns regarding the Indian cricket team’s upcoming matches, especially with a busy schedule ahead.
newTitle: Jasprit Bumrah Advised to Take Bed Rest Amid Injury Concerns

title: Really good signs for women's cricket: Smriti Mandhana - Cricbuzz
summary:
Really good signs for women's cricket: Smriti Mandhana

Date: Wed, Jan 15, 2025 Source: Cricbuzz

In a record-breaking match, India's women cricketers scored a historic 435 runs, showcasing significant improvement and team cohesion. Captain Smriti Mandhana expressed pride in her team's performance and highlighted their ongoing development.

  • India's batsmen scored a new record of 435/5 against Ireland.
  • Mandhana praised her team's effort and batting conditions in Rajkot.
  • The captain noted that the milestone wasn't planned at the start but developed during the game.
  • Mandhana emphasized the importance of match experience for building confidence in her players.
  • India's bowlers also excelled, adapting well to the pitch conditions.
  • Newcomer Pratika Rawal has been performing impressively alongside Mandhana.
“I think putting 400-plus, these are really good signs for women's cricket.” - Smriti Mandhana

The match not only highlighted individual performances but also marked a significant moment for women's cricket in India, signaling progress and potential growth in the sport.
newTitle: Impressive Milestone for Women's Cricket: Smriti Mandhana Celebrates New Records

title: Alejandro Garnacho 'transfer agreement reached' as Man Utd 'target £42m replacement' - Express
"Ban Indian players from having PR agencies": Harsha Bhogle suggests a new rule for Team India - Crictoday
summary:
“Ban Indian players from having PR agencies”: Harsha Bhogle suggests a new rule for Team India

Publication Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: Crictoday

Harsha Bhogle, a renowned sports presenter, has suggested banning Indian cricket team members from having public relations (PR) agencies following recent changes introduced by the BCCI.

  • The BCCI has implemented various rules for players after a recent defeat against Australia, including restrictions on travel and family visits.
  • Bhogle believes that banning PR agencies would be beneficial for the integrity of the team.
  • He expressed his views on social media, raising concerns about the impact of PR agencies on player reputation.
“Reading of the changes the BCCI is apparently suggesting for the Indian team. I don't know how much to believe but if I had to nominate one rule to be strictly applied, it would be to ban team members from having PR agencies”— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) January 15, 2025

The presence of PR agencies is said to encourage the spread of misinformation about players and can lead to conflicts of interest.

In conclusion, Bhogle's call for banning PR agencies highlights ongoing concerns about their influence in cricket.
newTitle: Harsha Bhogle Advocates for New Rule Against PR Agencies for Indian Cricketers

title: India squads for Champions Trophy, England ODIs Highlights: India's squad yet to be announced - Firstpost
Vijay Hazare Trophy: Padikkal, Shetty step up as Karnataka storm into final - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Karnataka Dominates Haryana to Reach Vijay Hazare Trophy Final

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: ESPNcricinfo

Karnataka secured a convincing victory over Haryana by five wickets, thanks to stellar performances from Devdutt Padikkal and Abhilash Shetty, propelling them into the Vijay Hazare Trophy final for the first time since the 2019-20 season.

  • Karnataka scored 238 runs for 5 wickets, overcoming Haryana's 237 for 9.
  • Padikkal scored 86 runs and shared a crucial 128-run partnership with Ravichandran Smaran, who contributed 76 runs.
  • Shetty excelled with the ball, taking 4 wickets for 34 runs, significantly impacting Haryana's batting order.
  • Karnataka will face either Vidarbha or Maharashtra in the final.
'I’m amazed myself' - Karun Nair reflects on record-breaking run.

In summary, Karnataka showed resilience and skill, demonstrating their potential as they move forward in the tournament.
newTitle: Karnataka Dominates Haryana to Reach Vijay Hazare Trophy Final

summary:

Publication Date: October 18, 2023 Source: NDTV

The opening ceremony for the Champions Trophy is set for February 16 or 17 in Pakistan, with hopes that Indian captain Rohit Sharma will attend despite India's matches being scheduled in Dubai due to security concerns.

  • The PCB is awaiting confirmation from the ICC regarding the captains' photo-shoot and press conference schedule.
  • The tournament begins on February 19 in Karachi.
  • The PCB has secured all necessary government clearances for visas for players and officials.
  • Indian nationals from the ICC delegation were issued visas promptly during their visit.
This obviously includes Rohit or any other Indian team player or official or board official.

The PCB emphasizes that the opening ceremony will be held in Pakistan, consistent with tournament protocols.
newTitle: Champions Trophy Captains' Meeting Scheduled for Pakistan Opening Ceremony

title: Pep Guardiola's wife 'called time on marriage after reaching final Man City decision' - The Mirror
summary:
Pep Guardiola's Wife 'Ended Marriage After Reaching Final Man City Decision'

Publication Date: 15:56, 15 Jan 2025

Source: Mirror

Pep Guardiola has separated from his wife, Cristina Serra, after 30 years together, influenced by his recent decision to extend his contract with Manchester City.

  • Guardiola signed a two-year contract extension in November, which reportedly strained their marriage.
  • His wife Cristina had relocated to Barcelona in 2019 for her fashion business.
  • Friends of the couple mentioned unusual behaviors suggesting tensions in their relationship.
  • The couple had previously spent Christmas together in Barcelona but decided on their future separately.
  • Lorena Vazquez and Laura Fa, respected reporters, stated there was no third party involved.
  • Guardiola's daughter emphasized their parents' focus on love and support in their family dynamics.
“The confirmation that Pep would stay at the Citizens until 2027 ended up breaking what was already cracked.”

This marital split highlights the personal sacrifices often involved in high-pressure careers, especially in the world of professional sports.
newTitle: Pep Guardiola's Marriage Ends After 30 Years Amid Contract Controversy

title: Top Xiangqi Grandmasters Banned For Life In Chinese Chess Scandal - Chess.com
summary:
Top Xiangqi Grandmasters Banned For Life In Chinese Chess Scandal

Publication Date: 2023-10-23
Source: Chess.com

A major cheating scandal has rocked the world of Chinese chess, leading to lifetime bans for several top players, including Wang Yuefei and Wang Tianyi.

  • A number of top Xiangqi players have received lifetime bans due to cheating scandals.
  • Wang Tianyi, a decorated player, is implicated in receiving bribes totaling 800,000 yuan.
  • The scandal became public after the Chinese Xiangqi Association issued bans in September.
  • Gai Hongyan stated that illegal activities have hindered the sport's development for over a decade.
  • 41 players have been penalized following a thorough investigation into match-fixing.

For over a decade, such illegal activities have been hampering the healthy development of the sport...

—Gai Hongyan

In conclusion, the extensive investigation uncovers a disturbing trend of corruption within the sport, threatening its integrity.
newTitle: Top Xiangqi Grandmasters Banned For Life In Chinese Chess Scandal
